faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Chemometrics is a discipline where (multivariate) statistical methods are applied on chemistry related data to extract information. The aim of the course is to give students overview and practical expirience of main methods in data analysis. This course covers main methods in descriptive statistics, exploratorary analysis (principal component analysis and cluster analysis) and data modelling (regression and classification analysis). Acquired knowledge can be used in graduation thesis or in other subjects that require statistical analysis.
description.et: Kemomeetria on teadusharu, mis kasutab statistilisi meetodeid, et ekstraheerida keemia alastest andmetest vajalikku informatsiooni. Käeoleva kursuse eesmärgiks on anda tudengitele ülevaade  ja praktiline kogemus põhilistest andmeanalüüsi meetoditest. Selle kursuse raames peatutakse põhilistel kirjeldava statistika meetoditel, uurimusliku andmeanalüüsi meetoditel (peakomponent analüüs ja klasterdamine) ja andmete modelleerimise meetoditel (regrassioon ja klassifitseerimine). Omandatud meetodeid on võimalik rakendada lõputöös või teistes statistilist analüüsi nõudvates ainetes.

objectives.en: A general methodology of data analysis is systematically studied and applied for the examination of specific chemical, technological or biomedical problems.
objectives.et: Kursus on suunatud põhiliste andmeanalüüsi valdkondade süstemaatilisele tundmaõppimisele ning selle tähtsamate meetodite rakendamisele konkreetsete keemiliste, tehnoloogiliste või biomeditsiiniliste probleemide lahendamiseks.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has successfully passed the course knows:
- different types of data and variables
- the main exploratory data analysis methods
- the main methods for data modelling
The student who has successfully passed the course is able to:
- use R programming language for data analysis
- visualize data and understand underlying relationships
- independently work and use statistical tools to solve problems
learning_outcomes.et: - iseseisvalt töötada ja kasutada statistika tööriistu probleemide lahendamiseks

learning_outcomes.en: - choose right method for data analysis
learning_outcomes.et: - lähtuvalt andmete tüübist valida sobiva meetodi andmete kirjeldamiseks

learning_outcomes.en: - perform different types of data analyses: principal component analysis, cluster analysis, regression analysis, and classification analysis
learning_outcomes.et: - teostada erinevaid analüüse: põhikomponent-, klaster-, klassiifitseerimis- ja regressioonianalüüsi

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.recommended_materials:
Introduction to Multivariate Statistical Analysis in Chemometrics, Kurt Varmuza, Peter Filzmoser, 2009 
Practical guide to chemometrics, Paul Gemperline, 2006
Statistics and chemometrics for analytical chemistry, James N. Miller, Jane Charlotte Miller, 2005

description.et:
Descriptive statistics and distributions
- Descriptive statistics 
- Data distributions
- Hypothesis testing, statistical tests
- Erroneous and missing data
Plotting and basic statistics with R

Multivariate data 1
- Univariate vs. multivariate
- ANOVA, covariance and correlation
- Data transformation 
- Data preprocessing (centering, scaling, normalization)

Multivariate data 2
- Distances, similarities 
- Multivariate outlier detection
- Linear latent variables

Principal Component Analysis
- Eigenvectors, Eigenvalues
- Number of PCA components
- Data preprocessing (centering and scaling)

Principal Component Analysis
- Statistical interpretation
- Rotation of planes
- Outlier analysis
- Other methods
PCA outliers and rotation of planes

Calibration and regression analysis
- Concepts
- Univariate calibration
- Multiple linear regression

Model diagnostics
- Variable selection
- Model selection
- Validation

Other MLR methods
- Linear models
- Non-linear models
- Tree-based models
